description.narrative: Culture Actions, seeks to harness the transformative power of the creative arts to challenge retrogressive societal norms aimed at reducing gender-based violence amongst women and girls aged 15 and 44 years; and at the same time mainstreaming environmental sustainability within targeted communities.

Sverige har bidragit till Zimbabwes kultur fond "Culture Fund" sedan 2006, och här föreslås ett ytterligare bidrag på sammanlagt 12 000 000 SEK för perioden 2017 till 2021. Ambassaden bedömer att projektet förhåller sig väl till nuvarande och kommande strategi för Sveriges utvecklingssamarbete med Zimbabwe, särskilt vad gäller teman som: jämställdhet, mänskliga rättigheter samt miljö- och klimatförändringar. Projektet syftar även till att synliggöra och utmana samhällsattityderna relaterade till genusrelaterat våld med särskilt fokus på barnäktenskap. Projektet avser även att öka människors medvetenhet kring miljömässig hållbarhet och klimatfrågor. Genom att använda kultur som metod ämnar man påverka och ändra nuvarande normer. Culture Fund avser även stärka kvinnors kunskap och roll som beslutstagare.
Ambassaden bedömer att projektet som syftar till att stärka förutsättningarna för jämställdhet och respekten för mänskliga rättigheter, med fokus på kvinnor och flickor, samt öka samhällens motståndskraft mot naturkatastrofer och klimatförändringar ligger väl i linje med Sveriges prioriteringar.
Ambassaden anser att projektet är i linje med det multilaterala utvecklingssamarbetets principer angående samfinansiering då Culture Fund även stöds av EU och USAID. Projektet ligger väl i linje med Agenda 2030 och kommer även att stärka genomförandet av de globala målen i landet.

The overall objective of the Culture Actions intervention is to: Harness the transformative power of the creative arts to challenge retrogressive societal norms aimed at; reducing gender based violence (GBV) amongst women and girls aged between 15 and 44 years. The updated results areas are: 1. Reduce Gender Based Violence (GBV) amongst girls and women aged between 15 and 44 years.2. Reduce child marriages for girls below the age of 18 years.3. Enhance capacities of communities to become resilient and adapt to climate change4. Increase agency by boys and men for reducing GBV amongst girls and women. Result area three has been updated to show how the intervention will enhance community preparedness and resilience beyond broader climate change awareness. This is particularly important for Chipinge and Chimanimani that have had negative effects of Cyclone Idai. The Embassy has assessed that with the prevalence in climate shocks it is critical to enhance community preparedness of the most vulnerable. This is in direct response to the Multi-dimensional Poverty Analysis conducted by the Embassy in 2019 that highlighted the need to strengthen preparedness for the most vulnerable communities. Result area four is new and emphasises the need to have increased agency by boys and men for reducing GBV amongst girls and women. While Culture Actions targeted women and girls, the intervention did not target men and boys as agencies for change. The upscale will design creative kits for engaging men and boys on cultural arguments fostering GBV, child marriage and climate change awareness. The Embassy assessed that the inclusion of men and boys will strengthen the results of the project, enhance the referral pathway through effective support structures and to a greater extent ensure continuity beyond Embassy funding. The intervention will work closely in strengthening the referral pathway for GBV victims. Emerging Culture Fund monitoring and evaluation, evidence points to a growing need for GBV and child marriage referral services through a proper tracking systems The involvement of men and boys in local communities will further ensure that these services are reached and that women and girls have the needed support.

participating-org.narrative: The Culture Fund of Zimbabwe Trust
The Culture Fund of Zimbabwe Trust

tag.narrative: 13.3 - Förbättra utbildningen, medvetenheten och den mänskliga och institutionella kapaciteten vad gäller begränsning av klimatförändringarna, klimatanpassning, begränsning av klimatförändringarnas konsekvenser samt tidig varning.
13.3 - Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning.
5.3 - Avskaffa alla skadliga sedvänjor, såsom barnäktenskap, tidiga äktenskap och tvångsäktenskap samt kvinnlig könsstympning.
5.3 - Eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The project has been able to achieve both planned and unplanned results despite the difficult circumstances. One main factor that has helped the project retain a level of visibility and presence in the target districts has been the good institutional partnerships with local government. Culture Fund and the project are known in the districts and memorandums of understanding with local leadrership have guranteed access despite restrictions. Culture Fund have also linked up and strenthened collaboration with other CSOs working with GBV. Some results: - Pre and post assessments of activities conducted pointed towards an increase in knowledge levels on GBV child marriage as evidenced by the uptake of referral services. Some victims of economic and physical abuse gained economic independence and made decisions to leave the abusive relationships. - As a result of mobile road show engagements across the districts (GBV, Child Marriages and Climate Change), 5932 community members reached against the 10 000 life-of-project target. - 130 traditional and religious leaders engaged - 31 have taken positive action towards project objectives. - 1806 women and girls were reached and completed GBV dialogue sessions against the target of 4000 - 189 women and girls were referred for post GBV services out of a target of the target of 420. - 951 versus a target of 2000 men and boys were engaged - Digital commemoration of the 16 days of activism against GBV enabled project broad awareness - Project supported Personal Protective Equipment (soap, buckets, gloves, sanitizers, masks) added value to implementing partners and community facilitators COVID-19 mitigating efforts
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
